intro: Rumicastrum baccatum, commonly known as the red-berried spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. Its most distinctive characteristic is the bright red, berry-like structures that form after flowering. These berries are often used in traditional medicine and are also a food source for certain wildlife species.
